author: sarareynolds.
content: Hi, at ACD couple weeks ago was suggested that we migrate the eip1153 tests https://github.com/ethereum/tests/pull/1091 into https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests. Can someone explain what ethereum/tests is used for versus this repo? Is ethereum/tests being deprecated and is the intention to rewrite the filler tests in python or to just move over the generated tests?

author: lightclient
content: `ethereum/tests` isn't being deprecated or anything. In fact, `ethereum/execution-spec-tests` outputs the same format as the "filled" tests in the first repo. During a testing discussion in bogota several other people were interested in experimenting with writing new tests in `execution-spec-tests` repository because it allows us to much more easily write tests that require programmatic generation (which is many of them). <@892053833121923094> has been leading things there and has been ironing out the test filler program. We don't really have any plans right now to rewrite the existing test yaml/json fillers. It will likely just be that new tests will be written here instead of `ethereum/tests`. But also very likely that both coexist for awhile.

author: sarareynolds.
content: Gotcha, so it sounds like its ok to to clean up the PR into ethereum/tests and for any new tests we can generate them this way instead?

author: sarareynolds.
content: I could also to rewrite a few in this new repo to try it out, if thatâ€™s helpful <@892053833121923094> just lmk!

author: marioevz
content: Yes absolutely, I think it would be really valuable to get more feedback since currently very few people have written tests in this new format

author: sarareynolds.
content: great sounds good, i'll play around. is this a good channel for questions wrt that repo?

author: lightclient
content: although tossing this up in any channel also usually works
